text:
*Question about Marketing and Workflow*
How can I enroll people in workflow when a deal is created ? 
I don’t find a enrollment criteria...
Is there an easy way to edit the hover state of a CTA that is generated with hubl?
Isn’t the CTA just a render of the CTA settings you set up when it is created/edited?
I would also just make sure your .css targets the hover states of whatever the HubSpot classes are for CTAs (I forget the nomenclature atm)
If the form is on a HubSpot page can’t you pass it into the url with hubl? then use hubl to check against the url on the redirect page?

I usually work with the CSS file, but if you need a CTA with the hover status working just with the CTA editor, you can achieve it creating the CTA classes inside the custom CSS tab.
It will looks like:
`#cta-unique-id{`
` /* normal status */`
`}`

`#cta-unique-id:hover{`
` /* hover status */`
`}`

It will print the CSS in the frontend and will work as how it should.
is there a way to get HubSpot to not auto-generate bootstrap span classes?

yes, use a coded template instead. that’s the only way.

Most of us just keep those classes and work with them, and add modifier classes to get the layouts we want.
Hey Jon, that is what I have been doing when necessary but I jut didnt know if there was a way around it. Appreciate it!
is there a best contact if we need some help sorting out an issue with an ecommerce bridge connection?
